Finding Her Location - 16 June 2023

â¤ï¸ Krishna Chaitanya June 17, 2023

Yesterday, she sent a snapâ€”laughing, enjoying her life without me. Hanging out with her friends like I never even existed. But itâ€™s not her fault. Itâ€™s mine.

I stared at the snap for a while, curiosity kicking in. Who were they? Where did she go? I zoomed in, trying to make sense of the details, but these damn Snapchat filters blurred everything, pixelating the image just enough to keep me guessing. Frustrated, I switched tactics. Her friendsâ€™ Instagram storiesâ€”I had to find something there.

And then I saw it. Her photo.

She looked so damn beautiful. That effortless smile, the way her hair fell perfectlyâ€”like the world was designed to make her glow. And then there was me. I caught my own reflection on the screen, and for a second, shame crawled up my spine. How did I even think sheâ€™d ever end up with someone like me? But that wasnâ€™t the point. She was Harshi. My Harshi. I had let her go so she could enjoy her life, and she was doing just that.

Still, my mind wouldnâ€™t rest. My eyes fixated on something in the background of her Instagram storyâ€”a board that read â€˜Kun Pre-Owned Cars.â€™ That was my clue. I Googled it immediately. Five locations in Chennai popped up. Five possibilities. I opened her location tag and started matching them one by one, checking every detail, cross-referencing like a damn detective. But I found nothing.

That wasnâ€™t enough to stop me. I went back, opened those locations again, this time through Google Street View. If I couldnâ€™t be there in person, Iâ€™d walk the roads virtually. And thenâ€”there it was. The exact place where she took the photo. So simple. Just connecting the dots in this digital world, a world that makes finding things too damn easy. And thatâ€™s why I hate this tech.

She had gone with her friends to â€˜60/94, Block V, V Block, Anna Nagar, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600040.â€™ The photo? Taken right beside an apartment named â€˜Grandeur, 65, Z Block, Kathiravan Colony, Anna Nagar, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600040.â€™

I sat back, staring at the screen. I found her. Again. Just like that. Even when I tell myself I need to let go, I keep chasing shadows. Itâ€™s ridiculous, isnâ€™t it? How I keep tracking every little detail of a life that Iâ€™m no longer a part of. But I guess thatâ€™s what happens when you leave someone behind without closureâ€”without a final word, without a reason. You leave them stuck in an endless loop of questions and what-ifs.

Maybe she doesnâ€™t think about me anymore. Maybe sheâ€™s happy. Maybe sheâ€™s even moved on. But here I am, stuck between the past and present, trying to decode a life that I was forced out of. And the saddest part? It doesnâ€™t even make me angry. It just makes me tired. Exhausted by my own inability to just stop caring.

Sheâ€™s happy. Let her be.

Thatâ€™s all that matters, right?
